review: It was a breeze to get this up and running. I have watched many streaming AMAZON videos and it was fast, smooth and no issues whatsoever. It should be noted that at this time, the TV must be on so the device does not go to sleep so you cannot stream music and then shut TV to listen. I spoke to tech support and this was by design and sent my comments to the design team. I understand reasons why they would do this, but maybe a setup options to change it may have been a good idea. For music from AMAZON, if you have Prime you can stream all that you have in their cloud, but not the other un-bought music that can be streamed on your computer that Amazon has given access to.On playing some albums besides the photo on the TV, the lyrics appear like Karaoke, not sure how or why, but it is cool.If you are a Prime member, and use AMAZON for video, AMAZON TV is certainly the way to go because it is so nicely setup for AMAZON. You still have NETFLIX etc, so those options are still there. So far I only used it for AMAZON. My setup is via wireless and had no performance issues at all. It works like I am using a DVD player in my house!
